meanings.sent1: She substituted her red pen for a blue one.
meanings.sent2: The teacher substituted the regular milk with almond milk.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to substitute the toy mouse for a real one.
meanings.sent4: His absence was substituted by a cardboard cutout.
meanings.sent5: The missing puzzle piece was substituted with a piece of paper.

meanings.definition: To use or add in place of another.
meanings.sent1: He substituted sugar with honey in his tea.
meanings.sent2: The chef substituted the beef with tofu in the stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to substitute his homework with a drawing.
meanings.sent4: Laughter can be substituted for medicine in some situations.
meanings.sent5: The broken chair leg was substituted with a rolled-up magazine.
